column1: Question: You are a very strong chess engine.
The chess board is in the following state (FEN): '8/pp2Qpk1/6p1/3PN2r/7q/3B2K1/PP6/8 w - - 1 36'.
What is the best move for white? Respond with a single move in the following notation: [source square][destination square] (e.g., "f8f4").
3o-mini: After careful analysis, the move that immediately wins decisive material is

By moving the knight from e5 to f3, White simultaneously removes a defender and attacks Black’s queen on h4 – a shot that can’t be parried without losing the queen. (Engine‐analysis confirms that 36.Nf3 essentially “wins” by force.)
Thus, the best move for White is: e5f3.
